meanings.definition: A person who supports or promotes something.
meanings.sent1: The favourers of the new policy were excited to see its positive impact.
meanings.sent2: The company's favourers helped spread the word about their innovative products.
meanings.sent3: The favourers of the local sports team always cheered the loudest at games.
meanings.sent4: She was a true favourer of the arts, always attending gallery openings and supporting local artists.
meanings.sent5: The favourers of the charity worked tirelessly to raise funds for those in need.

meanings.definition: Those who show kindness or preference towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The favourers of the stray animals in the neighborhood always made sure they had food and shelter.
meanings.sent2: She was known as one of the biggest favourers of helping the elderly in her community.
meanings.sent3: The favourers of the rainy weather were delighted to see dark clouds in the sky.
meanings.sent4: The garden was full of colourful flowers, attracting favourers like bees to honey.
meanings.sent5: The favourers of the underdog team were thrilled to see them win the championship.
